column4: I got a problem. Soon as I start up and log in to a gnome session, the panel is nowhere to be found. have to kill it and reboot.
ALT+F2 type 'gnome-panel' and run that
but it doesn't always startup right away.
If that doesn't work try gnome-terminal and run gnome-panel in that
But I need it to start up automatically. Get annoying to kill it and restart.
Mine doesn't showup in compizfusion somtimes, but its actually there when you click on it it magically appears
Hmm. I just installed fusion. Seems that the config app is br0ken, maybe that's it?
K, I'll see what happens.
Also I think compiz fusion needs to be a bit delayed at start if you know basic shell scripting you can use sleep to wait a little bit
Nope, same problem.
But I dont start it when I login. I use Beryl-manager to start up the special wm's.
http://pastebin.ca/699066 is what i get when I try to run ccsm
Looks like you need to install the compiz gconf plugin, also check that your running the uptodate version
I'll see.
found a package under compiz that seems to be it, installing.
http://pastebin.ca/699070 seems like that installing that one package didnt help much.
any ideas?
Nope, just make sure your using the very latest build
very latest build of compiz. checked out at around 1pm.
It might be worth trying to install everything in the repos that looks like its part of compiz
I think that some of the packages need to be updated.
if that doesn't work, i'm just going to remove it.
FIXED! Turns out that half of the packages were out of date. Should've seen that earilier. Now lets hope gnome-panel runs ok. :)
